alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 12 at 10:02AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central New Mexico, including the following areas, East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to 8 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. This includes the Hermit`s Peak - Calf Canyon Burn Scar. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches on the southern half of the burn scar Monday has increased the risk for flash flooding today. Showers and storms with heavy rainfall rates are expected this afternoon with localized amounts up to 2 inches possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
